meanings.definition: A word formed from a verb and used as an adjective.
meanings.sent1: The running child caught the ball.
meanings.sent3: The barking dog scared away the birds.
meanings.sent4: The glowing sunset painted the sky in hues of orange.
meanings.sent5: The howling wind echoed through the night.

meanings.definition: A verb form ending in -ing or -ed that functions as an adjective.
meanings.sent1: The singing birds woke me up early.
meanings.sent2: The excited children played in the park.
meanings.sent3: The barking seal entertained the crowd at the zoo.
meanings.sent4: The shining stars lit up the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The roaring lion scared the other animals.

meanings.definition: A verb form used in forming the progressive and perfect tenses.
meanings.sent1: She is reading a book in the library.
meanings.sent2: He has finished his homework already.
meanings.sent3: The dog was barking loudly all night.
meanings.sent4: Time is slipping away from us.
meanings.sent5: The sun has set, marking the end of the day.
